MENUS BYUSALLC
688-313-2970

Address: 1952 S Industrial Hwy, Ann Arbor, MI 48104
Description: Stalwart, unpretentious diner serving up familiar American, Italian & Mexican entrees, plus gyros.

summary.snippet: "The chicken tortilla wrap, fries, pink lemonade and the strawberry milkshake"
"Quiet and relaxing place to eat Great home cooked food"
"Good diner with loads to choose from - and the serving portions are great."

most_relevant.description: Benny’s was amazing. One of the best breakfast spots in Ann Arbor. Best customer service and great food. Got the Western Omelet and their rice pudding. So amazing!!
Good diner with loads to choose from - and the serving portions are great. Very friendly staff who are very attentive to their customers.

This is a really good quality family dining restaurant. The food is very fresh. I had the traditional turkey club which was absolutely delicious. The cappuccino is out of this world. Very nice owner and staff. My server has been with this place for 20 years and loves her job. They aim to please

I ordered the Slim Jim w\o tomato 🍅 and asked for Bacon 🥓 to be added. They definitely added bacon to the sandwich and it was perfect. Atmosphere was easy going with a wait staff that took care of you. Mom had the pancakes 🥞 and the scrambled eggs 🥚 🍳, (mini breakfast) she said she would highly recommend it.
I'm not much for soup but I got the chicken lemon 🍋 rice 🌾 🍚 with the combo (I'm going to try the coleslaw next time) and thought it could have a bit more pepper 🌶️ or spice, but I like things spicy 🥵
Love the location and off street parking 🅿️ (I'm missing a leg so ♿ parking is one of the first things I look for) and being so close to UofM yet off campus enough to not have to park on the street 🛣️ .

A neighborhood mainstay, the classic cozy diner experience!  Can't go wrong on the menu, especially for breakfast, and experience the spot where Michael Phelps used to eat his mountains of eggs.  Easy location on gamedays or anytime, fast service and lots of parking!

Hearty and great for those times when you want home cooked comfort food in large amounts. I especially like their omelettes (usually tender/not overcooked) and hash browns (not underdone and crisped on the outside and soft on the inside). I also enjoy the corned beef hash (comes w 2 eggs). Update: I have eaten in the restaurant 3 times with family.  They have friendly, very attentive servers and just good service all around. Kari/Carrie served us each time, and on the 3rd visit, she remembered everything extra we asked for the table on the last visits 😁!
The rest of the time I have done takeout. Prices are lower in person or if you call in your order versus order on DoorDash.
It is also nice that they are open Mondays.

Friendly service with a cozy environment. Not often crowded and loud, and usually no wait.

The food they serve is solid breakfast food for reasonable prices. Great for when you don't want to buy groceries and cook your own breakfast food, and still expect a satisfying meal in terms of taste and portion, and I consider myself a pretty big eater.
The Gyro and fries were delicious!  Service was prompt and friendly, lots of smiles!  Great place to take the family.
